creator: kamlesh_sharma_80@yahoo.com
text:
While using jmeter version 2.1.1 to test my J2ee(jdk 1.5.02) application.The
problem I am facing with session Managment.
I have created an Thread group, in which I added Http Default request element.
and Http Cookies Managment(config element) for Maintaining session for Multiple
Threads.When I tested my application with 15 Threads it's working fine. if i
increase number of threads more than 15 then it removes session.
and show folowing error in my log file:
"java.lang.NullPointerException" 
Since in Application code there is instances where I use session.getAttribute()
that code wont work since it does not get values from session.

I have to test my application for 1000 users, it is possible with jmeter?

creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
Please attach the full jmeter.log from a failed run.

Also the JMX file if possible - replace any sensitive data first!

creator: kamlesh_sharma_80@yahoo.com
text:
Created attachment 18393
jmter.log


Jmeter.log file does not shows "java.lang.NullPointerException" it show
IOException, when test failed, In My application I have logging the values of
session variable inside a file "application.log". This file shows
"NullPointerException" error.
I am sending you today's testing file "Jmeter.log"
You will see that I tested my application for 
Threads 	result

15		failed
10		passed 
20		failed
10		passed
15		passed 

I have attached "jmter.log" file.

creator: kamlesh_sharma_80@yahoo.com
text:
Created attachment 18394
Test Plan2.jmx

Here I attached Test Plan(.jmx file)

I can't see anything wrong with the JMeter side of things.

If I understand you correctly, the NPE is in your application, not JMeter. 
It is probably the cause of the IO Exceptions in jmeter.log.

Seems to me that JMeter has found a bug in the J2EE application - no matter what
the clients send it, it should not be possible to trigger an NPE.

As to testing with 1000 threads, that is a question for the JMeter user list.
creator: sebb@apache.org

text:
Created attachment 18850

I am also facing the same problem,not able to run the application,attaching the
log
creator: manojpant2002@yahoo.com

text:
I suggest you try again with the latest version of JMeter - i.e. 2.2.

If that also fails, please attach jmeter.log
